answers.answer: You could have Polycystic Ovarian Syndrome where you do not ovulate, which prevents you from getting pregnant.Go to your doctor again, and ask him if he concidered PCOS.

were close age am 34  and i had a pcos too ,u go check the doctor and they can decide what to do ,maybe you have a cyst or pcos ,but you have a regular menses ,probably its not a big issue .have u been checked like U/S ultrasound before ,..?or any check up and treatment ?

having a regular period every month dosent necesserely mean you ovulate, maybe all you need is clomid to help you ovulate if you dont have any pcos side effects all you might need is clomid!good luck.
or metformin the diabetes medicine that doesnt have the multiple birth side effect that I think Clomid has!!

I have already checked my felopian tubes. These are open and perfect. I also did folicle study , folicle developes and releases. But I am not sure about release b'coz at 13days dr give me a injection for releasing the egg.Thanks evrybody for comments.
hmm. that is odd. You need to ask him why he did that, if you were releasing like you should be.

question: I have an issue 7 yrs old. Now I am again trying to conceive but no success after a year. my hubby's sperm count are ok.I am using Clear blue monitor but it never shows evaluation. Although I have menses regularly.I meet the doctor and prescribed some vitamines. I am 35...What will be my bet for thas.
title: Problem in conceiving
